questions.text: Which member of the Justice League started the movie dead?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	The League, which also included Batman and Aquaman, was assembled during the movie. In a previous in universe film "Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice" Superman was killed. That chronology continued into this film. Superman was played by Henry Cavill.

questions.text: Which member of the Justice League was found in a prison?
questions.explanation:
The Flash.

	Batman, or Bruce Wayne, was trying to assemble the league. He found Aquaman in a remote fishing village, and he found Barry Allen (The Flash) in a prison visiting his father. Henry Allen was in prison for allegedly killing his wife when Barry was a child. The Flash/Barry Allen was played by Ezra Miller.

questions.text: Where did Steppenwolf appear first when he came to Earth?
questions.explanation:
Themyscira.

	Ciarán Hinds played the character in the movie. He appeared first on the island of Themyscira, Wonder Woman's home. He made easy work of defeating all of the Amazonian warriors and stole their Mother Box, which was one of three hidden on Earth.

questions.text: Which member of the team did Wonder Woman recruit?
questions.explanation:
Cyborg.

	Aquaman had already turned down Batman. Wonder Woman and Batman were working together at the start of the movie. Batman went to get The Flash, while Wonder Woman stayed in Gotham to recruit Cyborg. Cyborg was played by Ray Fisher.

questions.text: Which member of the team had never been in battle before joining?
questions.explanation:
The Flash.

	Right before they first did battle with Steppenwolf and the Parademons The Flash told Batman that he'd never been in a fight. He said he's ran fast and pushed a couple people, but never been in battle. Batman told him to focus on saving one of the hostages and the rest would come to him.

questions.text: Lex Luthor was used to bring a member of the team back to life.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The team used a similar process to bring Superman back to life as Lex Luthor had used in "Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice", however Luthor wasn't involved this time. This time the other members of the Justice League used one of the Mother Boxes as a power source to bring Superman back to life. In the previous movie Luthor has used the same chamber, but Kryptonian technology to bring a creature modified out of the body of Gen. Zod to life.

questions.text: Wonder Woman's boyfriend, Steve Trevor, ended up helping her save Batman from danger.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While Steve Trevor was mentioned several times in the movie, the character never appeared. Steve Trevor was killed several decades before the timeline of this movie. He died during the events of "Wonder Woman" which was the DC Comics movie released immediately before "Justice League".

questions.text: Which member of the team had no powers?
questions.explanation:
Batman.

	Batman was the only member of the team in the movie without any type of powers. All of his advantages were because of his wealth and smarts. At one point, when asked, he even told Barry Allen that being rich was his super power. Aquaman had powers related to the sea, along with super strength. Wonder Woman was descended from the gods, The Flash had super speed, Cyborg had implants that gave him advanced powers, Superman was an alien with many powers, then there was Batman and his gadgets.

questions.text: Which member of the team destroyed Steppenwolf's axe?
questions.explanation:
Wonder Woman.

	Wonder Woman, played by Gal Gadot, was portrayed as one of the stronger members of the team in the movie, second only to Superman. She went head-to-head with Superman during his resurrection. She was the one who managed to destroy Steppenwolf's axe, effectively defeating him. With the axe destroyed he showed fear, the fear had his own minions attack him.

questions.text: Bruce Wayne bought Clark Kent's mother a house, how did he do it?
questions.explanation:
Bought the bank.

	Martha Kent had sold the house that Clark had grown up in. She said it was just too big for her alone. At the end of the movie, Clark was resurrected; he and Bruce were standing near the house. Clark asked how Bruce got it back from the bank and Bruce replied that he bought the bank.
